Classes/GeoTrackEvent/Level.html#/s:11Ge.abstract: The human readable name for this log level

Classes/GeoTrackEvent.html#/s:11GeoTrack.abstract: The log level for this event (defaults to Info)

Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC14.name: altitudeChange
Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC14.abstract: The calculated change in altitude between the start and end point

Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC5i.abstract: Initializes the Leg with an index, point, direction, endIndex and endPoint

Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC12.name: trendChanged(direction:)
Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC12.abstract: Tells you if the trending direction has changed compared to the current direction. This function does have side effects (if the current direction is unknown, it will change to whatever the provided direction is).

Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC7c.name: compare(to:)
Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC7c.abstract: Compares the current relative point to the provided point to tell you the direction.

Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC15.name: isSameDirection(as:)
Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC15.abstract: Tells you if this leg is moving in the same direction as another leg

Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC9i.name: isBetween(left:right:)
Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC9i.abstract: Is this leg between the two provided legs?

Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC7c.name: combine(with:direction:)
Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC7c.abstract: This function is responsible for combining the current leg with another leg (into a new Leg), setting the direction and returning that result.

Classes/Leg.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit3LegC2e.abstract: Tells us if two legs are the same. They are the same if their indices, altitude and direction are the same.

Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html#/s:11GeoTr.name: altitudeSensitivity
Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html#/s:11GeoTr.abstract: The sensitivity of the track detection (in meters). If you set this too high, it won’t detect runs properly, if you set it too low, it will detect more runs than you actually have done

Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html#/s:11GeoTr.name: track
Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html#/s:11GeoTr.abstract: The track that we’re calculating the statistics from

Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html#/s:11GeoTr.name: legs
Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html#/s:11GeoTr.abstract: The [mutable] legs of the track (ascents and descents)

Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html#/s:11GeoTr.name: init(track:)
Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html#/s:11GeoTr.abstract: Initializes this Track Analyzer with a track. You must still call calculate() to generate the statistics. This isn’t done on construction for performance reasons.

Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html#/s:11GeoTr.name: calculate()
Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html#/s:11GeoTr.abstract: Calculates the statistics from the data set. It will populate the legs and the stats.

Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html#/s:11GeoTr.name: splitIntoLegs()
Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html#/s:11GeoTr.abstract: Assuming you’ve already run calculate, you can split this track into an array

Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html.name: GeoTrackAnalyzer
Classes/GeoTrackAnalyzer.html.abstract: This class is used to generate statistics about your track. Please note, this is a trivial implementation for ascent / descent detection. This implementation does not (currently) do any sort of noise reduction or utilize the vertical accuracy of the data to remove potentially erronious points. It might make sense (down the roade) to abstract a protocol from this and have multiple implementations to choose from that perform noise reduction or some sort of statistical smoothing to clean up the data for accuracy.

Classes/GeoTrackEvent.html.name: GeoTrackEvent
Classes/GeoTrackEvent.html.abstract: This class is used to track a GeoTrackEvent (for logging purposes).

Classes/GeoTrackManager.html.name: GeoTrackManager
Classes/GeoTrackManager.html.abstract: This class is responsible for managing (and brokering) everything related to tracking for you.

Classes.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit18NotAuthor.name: NotAuthorizedError
Classes.html#/s:11GeoTrackKit18NotAuthor.abstract: This error is raised when you don’t have proper authorization

Classes/DefaultMapZoom.html.name: DefaultMapZoom
Classes/DefaultMapZoom.html.abstract: This is an implementation of the default map zooming. It basically just states that you should always zoom to fit the points (whenever a redraw on the map is requested) and it calculates a zoom region that has a very tiny amount of padding around the points

Classes/GeoTrackMap.html.name: GeoTrackMap
Classes/GeoTrackMap.html.abstract: This class provides you an easy way to visualize your track on a map. You can configure the unknown, ascent and descent colors. They have sensible defaults. Using the UIGeoTrack model, you can set which legs of your track are visible and we’ll render them accordingly. Keep in mind, performance of this control may degrade if your tracks have too many points.

Classes/UIGeoTrack.html.name: UIGeoTrack
Classes/UIGeoTrack.html.abstract: A UI Model for a track. It keeps track of a Track (GeoTrack), a Track Analyzer (GeoTrackAnalyzer) and a collection of Legs (ascents, descents) that are currently visible

Classes/Stat.html.name: Stat
Classes/Stat.html.abstract: This class keeps track of statistics for a Leg (ascent or descent) of a track.

Classes/TrackStat.html.name: TrackStat
Classes/TrackStat.html.abstract: This class keeps track of statistics for an entire Geo Track. It summarizes the stats of all of the legs that comprise it and it keeps trak of the number of runs.

Classes/GeoTrack.html.name: GeoTrack
Classes/GeoTrack.html.abstract: Data structure to keep track of points for a track

Classes/GeoTrackLocationEvent.html.name: GeoTrackLocationEvent
Classes/GeoTrackLocationEvent.html.abstract: This class is responsible for keeping track of different types of track events. For example when the user starts tracking, stops tracking, pauses tracking, and your own custom event types.

Classes/ActivityService.html.name: ActivityService
Classes/ActivityService.html.abstract: A service that will get you workout activities, with a specific focus on those workouts that have associated

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
